column4: Quick question: if I want to dualboot ubuntu/win xp, linux can't access/write on NTFS, right?
it can, if you're prepared to take a small risk and install the fuse driver
to share data on a partition or removable drive between Windows and Linux, I recommend ext3 with a second extended filesystem driver for Windows.
work is under way, but it is difficult because NTFS is proprietary, poorly documented and has complex, rarely used features.
